item.title: “Remembering the Stonewall Uprising – 55 Years Later” Exhibit on Display in Folsom Library
item.description: Date: Friday, June 21, 2024 5:00 PM - Sun , July 21, 2024 7:00 PM - On June 28, 1969, LGBTQ+ patrons at the Stonewall Inn in New York fought back against police harassment, helping to spawn the LGBTQIA+ rights movement. To honor this event, the LGBTQ+ Task Force is proud to present an exhibit on the history of the Stonewall Uprising on the main floor of Folsom Library, using archival sources from the Stonewall National Museum, Archives, and Library to show the Uprising’s important history.

item.title: Tour of Curia Global Albany Campus to be Held for Arch Students
item.description: Date: Wednesday, July 10, 2024 10:00 AM - 2:00 PM - All Arch students are welcome to join the School of Science for an academic field trip to the Albany campus of Curia Global, a global contract research, development and manufacturing organization (CDMO) offering products and services across the drug development spectrum. The event will include a tour of the facilities, followed by lunch. Please contact the School of Science to sign up!

item.title: Rensselaer at Work Graduate Program Preview to be Held July 9
item.description: Date: Tuesday, July 9, 2024 6:00 PM - 7:00 PM - RSVP to join Dean Aric Krause, Ph.D. for a review of Rensselaer at Work’s part-time, project-based online graduate certificate and degree programs that are mentored by industry experts. Attendees will learn about programs in Engineering, Analytics, Leadership, and Technical Change Management, as well as the newly-released Program Management Certificate. Light refreshments will be provided.
